no-stats.description: do not give statistics on exit [*]

strict-parsing.description: be less tolerant of non-conforming inputs [*]

no-strict-parsing.description: do not be less tolerant of non-conforming inputs [*]

produce-models.description: support the get-value and get-model commands [*]

no-produce-models.description: do not support the get-value and get-model commands [*]

produce-assertions.description: keep an assertions list (enables get-assertions command) [*]

no-produce-assertions.description: do not keep an assertions list (enables get-assertions command) [*]

tlimit-per.description: enable time limiting per query (give milliseconds)

rlimit.description: enable resource limiting (currently, roughly the number of SAT conflicts)

hard-limit.description: the resource limit is hard potentially leaving the smtEngine in an unsafe state (should be destroyed and rebuild after resourcing out) [*]

unate-lemmas.description: determines which lemmas to add before solving (default is 'all', see --unate-lemmas=help)

heuristic-pivots.description: the number of times to apply the heuristic pivot rule; if N < 0, this defaults to the number of variables; if this is unset, this is tuned by the logic selection

standard-effort-variable-order-pivots.description: limits the number of pivots in a single invocation of check() at a non-full effort level using Bland's pivot rule (EXPERTS only)

error-selection-rule.description: change the pivot rule for the basic variable (default is 'min', see --pivot-rule help)

simplex-check-period.description: the number of pivots to do in simplex before rechecking for a conflict on all variables

pivot-threshold.description: sets the number of pivots using --pivot-rule per basic variable per simplex instance before using variable order

prop-row-length.description: sets the maximum row length to be used in propagation

enable-dio-solver.description: turns on Linear Diophantine Equation solver (Griggio, JSAT 2012)

disable-dio-solver.description: turns off Linear Diophantine Equation solver (Griggio, JSAT 2012)

enable-arith-rewrite-equalities.description: turns on the preprocessing rewrite turning equalities into a conjunction of inequalities

disable-arith-rewrite-equalities.description: turns off the preprocessing rewrite turning equalities into a conjunction of inequalities

enable-miplib-trick.description: turns on the preprocessing step of attempting to infer bounds on miplib problems

disable-miplib-trick.description: turns off the preprocessing step of attempting to infer bounds on miplib problems

miplib-trick-subs.description: do substitution for miplib 'tmp' vars if defined in <= N eliminated vars

cut-all-bounded.description: turns on the integer solving step of periodically cutting all integer variables that have both upper and lower bounds [*]

no-cut-all-bounded.description: turns off the integer solving step of periodically cutting all integer variables that have both upper and lower bounds [*]

maxCutsInContext.description: maximum cuts in a given context before signalling a restart

revert-arith-models-on-unsat.description: revert the arithmetic model to a known safe model on unsat if one is cached [*]

no-revert-arith-models-on-unsat.description: do not revert the arithmetic model to a known safe model on unsat if one is cached [*]

use-fcsimplex.description: use focusing and converging simplex (FMCAD 2013 submission) [*]

no-use-fcsimplex.description: do not use focusing and converging simplex (FMCAD 2013 submission) [*]

use-soi.description: use sum of infeasibility simplex (FMCAD 2013 submission) [*]

no-use-soi.description: do not use sum of infeasibility simplex (FMCAD 2013 submission) [*]

restrict-pivots.description: have a pivot cap for simplex at effort levels below fullEffort [*]

no-restrict-pivots.description: do not have a pivot cap for simplex at effort levels below fullEffort [*]

no-collect-pivot-stats.description: do not collect the pivot history [*]

use-approx.description: attempt to use an approximate solver [*]

no-use-approx.description: do not attempt to use an approximate solver [*]

approx-branch-depth.description: maximum cuts in a given context before signalling a restart

dio-decomps.description: let skolem variables for integer divisibility constraints leak from the dio solver [*]

no-dio-decomps.description: do not let skolem variables for integer divisibility constraints leak from the dio solver [*]

new-prop.description: use the new row propagation system [*]

no-new-prop.description: do not use the new row propagation system [*]

arith-prop-clauses.description: rows shorter than this are propagated as clauses

soi-qe.description: use quick explain to minimize the sum of infeasibility conflicts [*]

no-soi-qe.description: do not use quick explain to minimize the sum of infeasibility conflicts [*]

rewrite-divk.description: rewrite division and mod when by a constant into linear terms [*]

no-rewrite-divk.description: do not rewrite division and mod when by a constant into linear terms [*]

se-solve-int.description: attempt to use the approximate solve integer method on standard effort [*]

no-se-solve-int.description: do not attempt to use the approximate solve integer method on standard effort [*]

lemmas-on-replay-failure.description: attempt to use external lemmas if approximate solve integer failed [*]

no-lemmas-on-replay-failure.description: do not attempt to use external lemmas if approximate solve integer failed [*]

dio-turns.description: turns in a row dio solver cutting gets

dio-repeat.description: handle dio solver constraints in mass or one at a time [*]

no-dio-repeat.description: do not handle dio solver constraints in mass or one at a time [*]

replay-early-close-depth.description: multiples of the depths to try to close the approx log eagerly

replay-failure-penalty.description: number of solve integer attempts to skips after a numeric failure

replay-num-err-penalty.description: number of solve integer attempts to skips after a numeric failure

replay-reject-cut.description: maximum complexity of any coefficient while replaying cuts

replay-lemma-reject-cut.description: maximum complexity of any coefficient while outputting replaying cut lemmas
